fields.value: Satisfaction, convenience, and advantage of the smart device-based testing for medical students in Korea

authorAffiliation.value: Korea Institute for Curriculum and Evaluation
Korea Health Personnel Licensing Examination Institute

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Journal of Educational Evaluation for Health Professions

dsDescriptionValue.value: The evaluation survey was conducted for all 108 junior medical students of Kyungpook National University, Korea.  They took a practice licensing examination using SBT and filled out the evaluation survey in September 2015.  The evaluation survey for SBT was composed of three categories, satisfaction of SBT (2 items), convenience of SBT features (13 items), and advantages of SBT (13 items). The advantage of SBT is composed of two parts: one is comparing it with that of a paper and pencil testing and the other is comparing it with that of a computer based testing. The scale of the survey is 5 Likert type scale, 1-strongly disagree, 2-disagree, 3-neutral, 4-agree, 5-strongly agree.

keywordValue.value: Computers; Personal satisfaction; Republic of Korea; Medical students; Tablets
